result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Paszkiewicz, Tara L
defendant.address: 6314 West Lincoln Avenue, West Allis, WI 53219

records.addlTxt: Case referred back to Court.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Tara L Paszkiewicz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Tara L Paszkiewicz.  Prosecuting attorney Mallory Davis appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term of imprisonment of 4 years. The initial term of confinement in the Wisconsin state prison system is 2 years; the maximum term of extended supervision is 2 years. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation for 36 months.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 180 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Any unpaid amount will result in a civil judgment.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Jury Instructions 2150
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing on 9/23/22 at 1:30 pm. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case is rescheduled to 10/31/22 at 2:30 pm. Parties notified via email.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Tara L Paszkiewicz not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver, filed.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM BR. 29
Defendant Tara L Paszkiewicz in court, appear by video with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris, appear video.  Defendant Tara L Paszkiewicz in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.
to adjourn, filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Tara L Paszkiewicz in court,appear by video defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appears in person the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tara L Pasziewicz not in court, defendant in custody at Ozaukee County Jail. Navjot Hira appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing has been rescheduled to 10:00 on May 6, 2022.
Signed and filed, CPAU No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NMB (DOB 11/22/21); RKB (DOB 11/22/21); JH (12/23/15)

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Tara L Paszkiewicz in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Tara L Paszkiewicz in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tara L Paszkiewicz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
